intro: Porophyllum millspaughii, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Porophyllum millspaughii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
